application.doc: Creating a standard or virtual junction

param.name: reverseproxy_id
param.doc: The Reverse Proxy instance name.

param.name: appliance_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

method.name: POST
method.id: Creating a standard or virtual junction
method.doc: To create a standard or virtual junction with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP POST command on the Reverse Proxy Instances resource URI.

param.name: Authorization
param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: server_hostname
param.doc: The DNS host name or IP address of the target back-end server.

param.name: junction_point
param.doc: Name of the location in the Reverse Proxy namespace where the root of the back-end application server namespace is mounted. For standard junctions, the value is "/" followed by the junction name. For example, /test. For virtual junctions, the value is the junction name only. For example, test.

param.name: description
param.doc: An optional description for this junction.

param.name: junction_type
param.doc: Type of junction. The value is one of: tcp, ssl, tcpproxy, sslproxy, mutual. Default port for -t tcp is 80. Default port for -t ssl is 443.

param.name: junction_hard_limit
param.doc: Defines the hard limit percentage for consumption of worker threads. Valid value is an integer from "0" to "100".

param.name: junction_soft_limit
param.doc: Defines the soft limit percentage for consumption of worker threads. Valid value is an integer from "0" to "100".

param.name: basic_auth_mode
param.doc: Defines how the Reverse Proxy server passes client identity information in HTTP basic authentication (BA) headers to the back-end server. The value is one of: filter (default), ignore, supply, gso.

param.name: tfim_sso
param.doc: Enables IBM Security Federated Identity Manager single sign-on (SSO) for the junction. Valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: remote_http_header
param.doc: Controls the insertion of Security Verify Access specific client identity information in HTTP headers across the junction. The value is an array containing a combination of: iv-user, iv-user-l, iv-groups, iv-creds or all.

param.name: stateful_junction
param.doc: Specifies whether the junction supports stateful applications. By default, junctions are not stateful. Valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: http2_junction
param.doc: Specifies whether the junction supports the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, junctions do not support the HTTP/2 protocol. A valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: http2_proxy
param.doc: Specifies whether the junction proxy support the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, junction proxies do not support the HTTP/2 protocol. A valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: sni_name
param.doc: The server name indicator (SNI) to send to TLS junction servers. By default, no SNI is sent. Any valid DNS name is permitted.

param.name: preserve_cookie
param.doc: Specifies whether modifications of the names of non-domain cookies are to be made. Valid value is "yes" or "no". This parameter is not valid for virtual junctions.

param.name: cookie_include_path
param.doc: Specifies whether script generated server-relative URLs are included in cookies for junction identification. Valid value is "yes" or "no". This parameter is not valid for virtual junctions.

param.name: transparent_path_junction
param.doc: Specifies whether a transparent path junction is created. Valid value is "yes" or "no". This parameter is not valid for virtual junctions.

param.name: mutual_auth
param.doc: Specifies whether to enforce mutual authentication between a front-end Reverse Proxy server and a back-end Reverse Proxy server over SSL. Valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: insert_ltpa_cookies
param.doc: Controls whether LTPA cookies are passed to the junctioned Web server. Valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: insert_session_cookies
param.doc: Controls whether to send the session cookie to the junctioned Web server. Valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: request_encoding
param.doc: Specifies the encoding to use when the system generates HTTP headers for junctions. Possible values for encoding are: utf8_bin, utf8_uri, lcp_bin, and lcp_uri.

param.name: enable_basic_auth
param.doc: Specifies whether to use BA header information to authenticate to back-end server. Valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: key_label
param.doc: The key label for the client-side certificate that is used when the system authenticates to the junctioned Web server.

param.name: gso_resource_group
param.doc: The name of the GSO resource or resource group.

param.name: junction_cookie_javascript_block
param.doc: Controls the junction cookie JavaScript block. The value should be one of: trailer, inhead, onfocus, xhtml10, httpheader. Use trailer to append the junction cookie JavaScript to HTML page returned from back-end server. Use inhead to insert the JavaScript block between tags for HTML 4.01 compliance. Use onfocus to use the onfocus event handler in the JavaScript to ensure the correct junction cookie is used in a multiple-junction/multiple-browser-window scenario. Use xhtml10 to insert a JavaScript block that is HTML 4.01 and XHTML 1.0 compliant. Use httpheader to insert the junction cookie as a standard HTTP cookie in the HTTP response headers.

param.name: client_ip_http
param.doc: Specifies whether to insert the IP address of the incoming request into an HTTP header for transmission to the junctioned Web server. Valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: version_two_cookies
param.doc: Specifies whether LTPA version 2 cookies (LtpaToken2) are used. Valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: ltpa_keyfile
param.doc: Location of the key file that is used to encrypt the LTPA cookie data.

param.name: authz_rules
param.doc: Specifies whether to allow denied requests and failure reason information from authorization rules to be sent in the Boolean Rule header (AM_AZN_FAILURE) across the junction. Valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: fsso_config_file
param.doc: The name of the configuration file that is used for forms based single sign-on.

param.name: username
param.doc: The Reverse Proxy user name. Used to send BA header information to the back-end server.

param.name: password
param.doc: The Reverse Proxy password. Used to send BA header information to the back-end server.

param.name: server_uuid
param.doc: Specifies the UUID that will be used to identify the junctioned Web server. This field is used for stateful junctions.

param.name: server_port
param.doc: TCP port of the back-end third-party server. Default is 80 for TCP junctions and 443 for SSL junctions.

param.name: virtual_hostname
param.doc: Virtual host name that is used for the junctioned Web server.

param.name: server_dn
param.doc: Specifies the distinguished name of the junctioned Web server.

param.name: server_cn
param.doc: Specifies the common name, or subject alternative name, of the junctioned Web server.

param.name: local_ip
param.doc: Specifies the local IP address that the Reverse Proxy uses when the system communicates with the target back-end server. If this option is not provided, the Reverse Proxy uses the default address as determined by the operating system. If you supply an address for a particular junction, the Reverse Proxy is modified to bind to this local address for all communication with the junctioned server.

param.name: query_contents
param.doc: Provides the Reverse Proxy with the correct name of the query_contents program file and where to find the file. By default, the Windows file is called query_contents.exe and the UNIX file is called query_contents.sh. By default, the Reverse Proxy looks for the file in the cgi_bin directory of the back-end Web server. Required for back-end Windows and UNIX Web servers.

param.name: case_sensitive_url
param.doc: Specifies whether the Reverse Proxy server treats URLs as case sensitive. Valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: windows_style_url
param.doc: Specifies whether Windows style URLs are supported. Valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: ltpa_keyfile_password
param.doc: Password for the key file that is used to encrypt LTPA cookie data.

param.name: https_port
param.doc: HTTPS port of the back-end third-party server. Applicable when the junction type is ssl.

param.name: http_port
param.doc: HTTP port of the back-end third-party server. Applicable when the junction type is tcp.

param.name: priority
param.doc: The priority of the server (1-9). Default is 9.

param.name: proxy_hostname
param.doc: The DNS host name or IP address of the proxy server. Applicable when the junction type is sslproxy.

param.name: proxy_port
param.doc: The TCP port of the proxy server. Applicable when the junction type is tcpproxy.

param.name: sms_environment
param.doc: Only applicable for virtual junctions. Specifies the replica set that sessions on the virtual junction are managed under. The replica set also provides the ability to group or separate log in sessions among multiple virtual hosts. If this option is not used to specify the replica set, the virtual host junction is automatically assigned to a replica set matching its virtual host name. For example, if the virtual host name is vhostA.example.com, the replica set is named vhostA.example.com. The replica set used for the virtual host junction must be present in the [replica-sets] stanza of the Reverse Proxy configuration file. This option cannot be used in a non-DSC environment.

param.name: vhost_label
param.doc: Only applicable for virtual junctions. Causes a second virtual junction to share the protected object space with the initial virtual junction. This option is appropriate for junction pairs only (2 junctions with complementary protocols). The option does not support the association of more than 2 junctions.

param.name: force
param.doc: Specifies whether to overwrite an existing junction of the same name. Valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: delegation_support
param.doc: This option is valid only with junctions that were created with the type of ssl or sslproxy. Indicates single sign-on from a front-end Reverse Proxy server to a back-end Reverse Proxy server.

param.name: scripting_support
param.doc: Supplies junction identification in a cookie to handle script-generated server-relative URLs.
